work.title: Kantate ved Aarhus Landsudstillings Aabnings-Højtidelighed 1909
Cantata for the Opening Ceremony of the National Exhibition in Aarhus 1909
Kantate ved Århus landsudstillings åbningshøjtidelighed 1909

history.p: Nielsen was requested to compose music for the cantata in July 1908. At first he rejected the commission but later accepted it. After having received parts of the text in November, he had to back out. A number of other composers declined the offer too, and in the end Nielsen and his pupil, Emilius Bangert, shared the work equally between them. Bangert finished the fair-copying of the whole work in February 1909.

bibl.author: Johan Bender
bibl.title: Tilblivelsen af Carl Nielsens kantate til Landsudstillingen 1909
Publimus

termList.term: Music for vocal soloists and instruments with or without choir

incipText.p: Alt, hvormed Tidens Tanker har famlet
Hvidt som et Tempel i Fortids Athen

relation.label: To sange fra "Kantate ved Aarhus Landsudstillings Aabnings-Højtidelighed 1909"

annot.p: Source includes a letter from Emilius Bangert to the State and University Library, Aarhus, 8 March 1927.

titleStmt.title: Piano score, autograph (Emilius Bangert), fair copy

annot.p: Bass solo part with piano (No. 4, bb. 51–143). Fair copy by Emilius Bangert with some additions in pencil by Nielsen.

titlePage.label: Title on first page
titlePage.p: KANTATE / VED / AABNINGS = / HØITIDELIGHEDEN / DEN . 18 . MAI . / 1909.
FESTSKRIFT / LANDSUDSTILLINGEN / I AARHUS / VED / L. FRIIS / LANDSUDSTILLINGENS GENERALSKRETÆR / AARHUS / FORLAGET AF 1907, A/S / MCMIX

annot.p: Programme for Dansk Koncertforening’s concert on 25 April 1910, with L.C. Nielsen’s text for the cantata.
